CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 15, 1957, pg. A11 reads: "Pageant Performers - The Madison School pupils and teachers presented a Memorial Day pageant, "The Graveyard of Freedom," which was written by the school's principal, Mr. Arnold, at the final P-TA meeting of the year. The children dramatized the important phases of American history from the "Explorations of Columbus" to the "Horizons of the United Nations."  Some of the youthful actors were Amelia Catlin, Adrenia Moris, Colette Carpenter, Carolyn Chapman, James Davis, Carol Finch, Donna Washington, David Glass, Leasure Duncan, Juliebeck Washington, Brenda Burton, Florence Manns, Delaine Crump.  Mrs. Thelma Lovette is the P-TA president, and Thomas G. Arnold is adviser. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group, including Amelia Catlin, Adrenia Moris, Colette Carpenter, Carolyn Chapman, James Davis, Carol Finch, Donna Washington, David Glass, Leasure Duncan, Juliebeck Washington, Brenda Burton, Florence Manns, and Delaine Crump wearing Native American inspired costumes, gathered in Madison School classroom for Memorial Day pageant
